name: World Chess Championship
description: The pinnacle of chess, where the reigning World Champion faces a challenger to determine the world’s top player.

name: Tata Steel Chess Tournament
description: One of the most prestigious chess tournaments featuring top global players and up-and-coming talents.

name: Candidates Tournament
description: A major tournament that determines the challenger for the World Chess Championship.

name: FIDE World Cup
description: A knockout tournament that serves as a qualifier for the Candidates Tournament.

name: Chess Olympiad
description: The largest team chess event where countries compete for the Olympiad title.

name: Grand Chess Tour
description: A series of high-level chess tournaments taking place across the globe with a cumulative prize fund.

name: Sinquefield Cup
description: A major stop on the Grand Chess Tour, featuring top players.

name: Superbet Rapid & Blitz
description: Part of the Grand Chess Tour, this event emphasizes faster time controls like rapid and blitz.

name: Norway Chess
description: One of the strongest invitational tournaments, featuring innovative formats like Armageddon games to break ties.

name: Speed Chess Championship
description: An online event organized by Chess.com where top players compete in fast time controls.
